page.title: 02Barnby in the W. Population
page.content: Approximately 90 households. 214 on the electoral roll ( + 52 children). There is a general spread across the whole age range. Most of the older residents have lived here for most of their life, many since they were born.Most of the younger families have moved into the village rather than having been born here. In general the population is now fairly stable. As there is little employment in the village the majority of people travel out of the village to work. Of those working in the village there are two pig farmers, a dairy farmer, a chicken farmer(eggs), three arable farmers, a plumber and a craftsman who works in brass. Primary school children travel to Coddington and secondary school children to Balderton.
